He rightly points out that we are making huge decisions with crappy data, and he is right that we should (immediately) put into place surveillance for COVID19. Many smart scientists are working full time to assemble such data and fill in holes in data we have.

2/

Given all the data uncertainties, reasonable estimates for the case fatality ratio (CFR) of COVID19 in the general U.S. population could be between 0.05% (half as deadly as the flu) to 1% (ten times as deadly as the flu), according to Ioannidis! That's a huge range.
